text: Sir Edward Lee French, KCVO (22 July 1857 – 17 May 1916) was an English-born senior officer in the Indian Police Force. == Life == Edward Lee French was born on 22 July 1857,Dod's Peerage, Baronetage, Knightage, Etc. of Great Britain and Ireland (1923), p. 340. the son of Rev. Frederic French (1823–1907), JP, rector of Worlingworth with Southolt, in Suffolk, and his wife, Anna Maria (d. 1901), eldest daughter of John Davis, JP, DL (d. 1864), of Cranbrooke Park, Essex. He was baptised at Worlingworth. The Rev. French's family came from Eye, Suffolk; his father Thomas was banker to the Henniker family, patrons of Worlingworth's rectory. This connection helped secure Frederic French, newly graduated from the University of Cambridge (BA 1847, MA 1850), the living at Worlingworth, which he held from 1853 to his death in 1907.See, for parentage, Dod's Peerage, Baronetage and Knightage of Great Britain and Ireland ... (1914), p. 471; and Walford's County Families of the United Kingdom (1913), p. 447. Dod's gives his maternal grandfather as William Davis, but he is John Davis in B. Burke, A Genealogical and Heraldic History of the Landed Gentry of Great Britain and Ireland (1879), vol. 1, p. 434; the marriage, between Anna Maria, eldest daughter of John Davis, of Cranbrooke Park, and Frederic French, rector of Worlingworth, was recorded in the Bury and Norwich Post, 2 November 1853, p. 2.For details of the Rev. French, see J. Venn and J. A. Venn (eds), Alumni Cantabrigienses (Cambridge, 1944), vol. 2, part 2, p. 576; and "Revered Frederic French (1823–1907)", Worlingworth Local History Group. Retrieved 18 April 2017. Following schooling at Marlborough,"Sir Edward Lee French", The Annual Register, vol. 158 (1917), p. 170. Edward French entered the Indian Police in 1879. He was appointed Deputy Inspector-General in the Criminal Investigation Department for the Punjab in 1905. Three years later, he was made Inspector-General of the North-West Frontier Police and then, in 1909, of the Punjab Police. In this capacity, he placed in charge of the police during the Coronation Durbar of 1911,"French, Sir Edward Lee", Who Was Who (online edition), Oxford University Press, 2014. Retrieved 18 April 2017. when King-Emperor George V appointed him a Knight Commander of the Royal Victorian Order.P. Galloway, D. Stanley and D. Martin (1996), Royal Service, vol. 1 (London: Victorian Publishing, 1996), pp. 120–125.. In 1886, he married Wilna, daughter of David Ross, CIE at Hoxne. He died on 17 May 1916. == References == Category:Indian Police Service officers Category:1857 births Category:1916 deaths
title: Edward Lee French
